reviews.review_msg: Professor does not provide clear instructions for key graded activities. When reaching out the feedback is poor, and fails to answer or clarify the question being asked.

She's a very friendly person and is fairly approachable, but her class was very confusing and I feel as if I didn't learn that much. I didn't get how the readings were connected to course material, had no idea how I would be graded, and we were behind schedule by 2 weeks. I was really interested in the concept so it felt like I was snubbed a bit.

Extremely caring, open to feedback, and approachable. But lectures were rambling and didn't really go anywhere. Lectures stopped happening later because the schedule to do presentations involved multiple students presenting on the same reading each week, and we fell way behind schedule. Discussion-based class, but discussions didn't do a ton.

By far the worst class I've taken at SFU. Jie argued with her students, was generally rude, and created an uncomfortable classroom environment. Lectures were rambling and incoherent. Poor choice of readings offered little insight into the topics at hand. Showed up late to class every single time. This person needs to take a class on teaching.

Prof. Yang is an exceptional instructorâ€”knowledgeable, dedicated and invested in students' learning
I took SA 870; her lectures are thorough and well-prepared. She challenges us to think critically and doesn't give easy grades
At times RMP reviews reflect personal frustrations, not fair assessments
Highly recommended for those committed to learning

Has a really thick accent that is almost impossible to comprehend. She speaks very quickly too, which doesn't help. She is rude, combative, unwilling to accept a perspective other than her own, and does not care about her students (I had been in her class since the beginning of the term, and in week 6, she thought I was a recently enrolled student)
I will take another course with theis instructor again and wanted to turn to linguistic anthropology.

took two in person courses and one online course with this professor, laid back but caring, very knowledgeable and easy to talk with. I had difficulty with my term paper, but a zoom chat with her solved all my concerns.

I thought Jie Yang was an amazing professor. I think what makes her seem inaccessible to some if that she is an incredibly intelligent person. Tough weekly assignment. But, she is a fair grader and an understanding, compassionate person. She has the most calming voice. Generally, the easiest way to go about this course is to listen to her lectures.

Nice person, theory driven, did give a lot of examples. Funny. making the online course really a community of support. SHe treats students as peers, and give you a lot of space for personal voices. like her.
great prof. nice person. actually very sweet. I have taken her course three times in a row. It is her who taught me the importance of language.

She gets all the opposite tags. She is not caring, she doesnt give ANY feedback, she doesnt care about her students. I honestly dont know how she got to teach at SFU! 13 years? She cant even pronounce theories correctly, let alone TEACH. She gets mad when you ask questions, and doesntt give us any guidelines. Slides are useless. WILL UPDATE AT END!

She does not care about her students, period. It is clear she knows her stuff, mainly her research, but will not support alternative views. If you need some sympathy from her, do not count on it, she will not give it to you. Incredibly pretentious outside of class. Remember to agree with everything she says or you wont get the mark you want.
Passionate prof, flexible and easy going, she can sometimes funny. I like the marking scheme. she treats students almost as peers and allows you to talk and present a lot. Will take her again.

Jie is really smart and very informative however she is a terrible professor. In 201, we were required to facilitate a 2 HOUR presentation in pairs and the mark for this presentation was lumped into our participation grade worth a total of only 15%. Her tests are extremely obscure and very long. I would never willingly take another class with her

I took courses with this prof twice in a row. Like her testing schemes. SHe does not ask you to memorize but you have to really understand. COme to class and she sometimes will give clue to the possible topics for the final test. fair marker.
great course, nice instructor, very accessible, friendly, fair marker, no memorization but open book test, but you have to come to class to understand the contents. Will take her again
I really like her teaching styles, open and flexibile. Tests are all open book no need to memorize anything, but you have to come to class to really understand those concepts. fair marker

Jie was okay. She wasn't really clear on what she wanted from the students at the beginning, and you were only able to figure it out if you saw her in office hours. Even then, I was still unsure of what she wanted. The final exam was terrible. It was basically us having to search through all the readings and group presentations and lecture notes.

Jie treats you as an equal instead of as a student, as long as you pay attention. Assignments were easy and open-ended, however it's VERY important that you clarify what she's looking for. SA201 is all about discussions, so you'd better be familiar with the big topics in humanities (like Neoliberalism) because she didn't explain them in depth.

Great course. very enthusiastic instructor. I registered this course to study CDA but actually really like the range of topics covered at class. The test format is really flexible and open. a quite creative instructor. give students freedom to air.
wasn't satisfactory and engaging
not recommanded

in general a good class, the instructuor is very friendly and accessible. The videos are great! I actually really like linguistic anthropology and want to choose it for a MA  program. But I haven't got a grade yet so far and don't know below someone already said recieve a b-grade. for mid-term, she was very fair.

She is a breath of fresh air in terms of her passion and scholarship. A fair marker. She asks for a lot of dedication at class and active participation but she seems to work hard to help students. I had a lot of respect for this prof. Like the format of the lecture and test. will take her again

Jie is a very nice teacher who is very supportive of her students. Unfortunately at times she can be vague about what she expects, as well she can sometimes be a little unclear due to her accent. But I did barely any work for her courses, and the format made me come back twice in a row. 10/10 would recommend.
I really enjoyed my class with Jie. She is always very helpful and she is a fair marker.

Jie is a wonderful instructor. She is very enthusiastic about the material. She literally replies within minutes to my emails. Jie did not assign a textbook and instead emails articles to read each week, the articles are interesting and it was wonderful to not have to pay for another useless textbook.

a good prof takes students... students opinions seriously but would hope she never waters down theories because of students' poor understanding...like her teaching philosophy...testing understanding not memory
me too--took al her three courses so far all are good..fair marker..openbook test
i do very wellwith this prof. good one, relaxing class allow to speak
actually very kind person great prof, quite open minded about the final essay topic i talked to her once at her office, nicetoo.

Jie can be nice in lecture, but shes very strong (often bias) about what she teaches so she's not open-minded about other's opinions and challenges. She looks at you like you're dumb if you ask a question and she is bad at explaining important concepts. When you ask her for clarifications outside of class, she kinda shoos you away. Never again!
she is tough the midterm quiz was marked kind of hard but she is easygoing prof. and fun.the great thing about jie she encourages you to speak and you are not afraid to speak at class

enjoy the class so far--jie is a great a facilitator--the class presentation is especially fun. cannot believe this is 200 level class--she allows students to do a lot of independent work good for professional development.

Yes, a decent and brilliant prof. the open book final test is not easy. I would prfer close book test. the questions she gave are hard to answer--you cannot find answers and have to summarize or conceptualize. the time is limited. other than this,the course was fun. jie can be very funny.

Decent professor...the great part about her was that u didnt need to purchase a text for this course...she provides the material for you.  mt and final open book...expectations and criteria was decent...i got a C+ for not really doing anythinf so im pretty satisfied lolll...attendance is not mandatory jus show up a few times then itll be ok

great prof. very insightful. when I registered this course, I laughed about myself why I chose a China course. But it turned out such a great experience. It's not about China,Jie also taught about theories. very thought-provoking.

I thought this course is a special topic class but it turned out a breadth course. It should be listed as a breadth course. Jie is so theory driven, I only understand her until she gave examples. Her examples are good and she allowed a lot of discussion at class. In general, good class.

Jie is a great instructor, very enthusiastic about what she taught. A very understanding professor and open to suggestion and discussion. What I like her class is she is not dominating the class and gives students room to talk and ask questions. Bur four hours Monday morning class was too much.
Super enthusiastic about her subject but I find her very difficult to follow during the lecture. It's like she is talking but not really saying anything. Very passionate about her work.

the person below nails it. I just took this same course with her. She was very generous, compassionate person. We were taken to the vancouver art gallery for a field trip--she paid for all the tickets. I mean come on, a prof. just for the students to learn more about China.  And her course offers not only about China but also great theories.

I read comments on this page and feel like that people could be so biased. I am not her favourite student but I do want to say Jie is probablay the most enthusiastic professor I have ever had so far at sfu. A very dynamic and super nice, even accommodating professor. I couldn't understand why people could say things like she gave bad looks?!

I would definitely follow this prof! She is very nice, helpful, patient, etc. Likes to talk and lets others talk as well. Some comments here mention her 'yelling' and/or being 'defensive' - I can't even imagine her with such behaviour; far from it! She is very open to differing opinions.

Jie is nice and is interested in what she teaches, but NEVER again will I take a class with her.  She makes you feel stupid when you ask her a question.  Not only does she give you a look(which makes me feel stupid), but she also doesn't know how to explain her answers.  She expects you to get her right away.  She rarely respond to your email
I really like Jie. She is such a pleasant, enthusiastic person. I like all her China examples and her fieldwork stories which make this theory course very interesting. she is a fair marker too.

It's obvious she has an accent but she is very competent. Her problems is the concepts she taught are too complicated. she thought students are all third-year students. No. many students in this class has no anthropological background. She doesn't communicate grades via email or anything she already taught at class.

I have to say that students are so hard on this professor, not many people showed up at class. Some students were constantly late, so rude, disturbing to the professor and to the students. I feel so embarrassed. But this is an very interesting course. The materials and perspectives are so fresh.

Jie Yang is a wonderful person; however, her inability to communicate material and her poor class syllabus makes being in her class extremely frustrating. She takes forever to answer emails, and refuses to answer questions via email and insists that we meet her in person, which we may not always have time for. I will never take her class again.
Love her class. Theory driven but her teaching made me think.

Jie is great teacher. very enthusiastic about theories and good at teaching theories. And also she has a great personality, very pleasant and optimistic. She could easily come up with some moving anecdotes to cheer you up. But some of her theories are very updated and may take a while to understand, but she reviewed alot.

She is a very fair, easy-going professor. All the exams are open-book, but still a bit hard to cope with. I think students are still not very familiar with linguistic anthropology stuff. One important thing I learned from her is critical discourse analysis. The readings are interesting and engrossing.

She's an all right teacher. Her instructions on criteria of the papers are very confusing. Also, she sends a lot of chunky articles but we hardly learn anything about them. She is a friendly person but her classes are long and extremely boring. She marks the midterms very hard, even though they are "open-book".

I have a quite pleasant experience with this professor. The lectures are organized and quite informative, mixed with video and lively discussions. The strength of this professor is she is very open to suggestions and open to creative, alternative ideas. But four hour lecture is just too long, early Monday morning.

Honestly she was probably too nice and too accommodating students' needs. She was the very few professors who could constantly reviewed what she taught and gave a final review before final tests. Her tone may sound yelling at moments but I don't think she is bad-tempered. I'lltake another course with her.

She sent everything to students, her lecture slides, readings, which was very good, helpful, but it's really hard to understand all the concepts if you only study the slides. You have to come to her lectures, but you'll learn a lot. She worked hard to help students sincerely, which is very rare at this university. Sfu make sure to keep her.

She was nice and very accessible and patient especially when you went to her office hours. She answered emails very quickly. She not only taught about China but also useful theories. I even used the theories learned from her course in my assignments for other courses. I'd like to take other courses from this professor.
Good professor. She is very open to discussion and suggestion, creating a very open and healthy learning environment. I highly recommend this professor.

The two people below me nailed it.  Her lectures are not entirely clear and she does a poor job of explaining key concepts.  Classes aren't particularly well-planned either.  Will not take another class taught by her again. She does mark fairly though!
She was nice but she did get offended a lot and took comments personally, but i would recommend her she is very informative

not open minded, short-tempered with students who "challenge" her statements, even though it's just a suggestion/opinion/thought. Her way or the highway..wouldn't take a class with her again. Lectures are brutal, content was difficult to understand under her wording sometimes, but she does mark easy.
Have some accent, good teaching though.
Cool prof. Very informative and enthusiastic.
She will become one of the most enthusiastic professors at SFU. very helpful and pleasant professor. Cool.
She is a very helpful and enthusiastic professor, and really knows China.

Would not recommend her as a professor. She knows her stuff but can't teach it. She took things personally, and was on a short fuse most of the time. I think she may become a better prof in the future but she hasn't been teaching long enough. Take her classes only if you are very patient and don't expect to learn much!
This is a phenomenal professor. Very approachable, very insightful.Enthusiastic lecturer.
Easy marker but really confusing. Yelled at students in class! Highly unpredictable.
